alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe; Franklin; Halifax; Nash; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 4:47PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Warren, Nash, northwestern Edgecombe, northwestern Halifax and central Franklin Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 446 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Louisburg to near Bunn. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rocky Mount, Roanoke Rapids, Nashville, Louisburg, Dortches, Littleton, Bunn, Red Oak, Enfield and Sharpsburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These thunderstorms are producing an excessive amount of deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter indoors and stay away from windows. If you cannot seek shelter indoors, an enclosed vehicle can provide safe shelter. Deadly lightning strikes can occur well ahead of an approaching storm, prior to the arrival of rain and wind. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central North Carolina.
